title: Ex-Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio jailed for 22 years for Capitol riot
description: An emotional Enrique Tarrio, 39, tells the court he is "ashamed" of his role in the US Capitol riot.

title: The million-dollar hustle changing US sport - how college football athletes are cashing in
description: American student athletes, who previously only received compensation from universities in the form of scholarships, can now earn money for endorsement deals. It is changing campus bank balances and the shape of stateside sport.

title: Happy Valley: Sarah Lancashire wins big at National Television Awards
description: Ant and Dec also win best presenter for the 22nd year running but there was no prize for This Morning.

title: England v New Zealand: Watch the tourist's 'monster' sixes to level series
description: Watch New Zealand's "monster" sixes as they beat England by six wickets at Trent Bridge to draw the four-match T20 series.

title: US Open 2023 results: Coco Gauff beats Jelena Ostapenko to reach semi-finals
description: American teenager Coco Gauff storms into the US Open semi-finals for the first time with a dominant win over Latvia's Jelena Ostapenko.

title: Sand dredging devastating ocean floor, UN warns
description: Around six billion tonnes of sand is dredged from the world's oceans every year, a new report says.

title: 13 schools with RAAC had building work scrapped
description: The schools were among those that lost out when Building Schools for the Future was cancelled.

title: Wagner to be declared a terrorist organisation by UK
description: It will become illegal to be a member of or support the Russian mercenary group.

title: US Open 2023 results: Novak Djokovic beats Taylor Fritz in straight sets to reach semi-finals
description: Novak Djokovic reaches a record 47th men's Grand Slam semi-final with a straight-set win over Taylor Fritz at the US Open.

title: Premier League: Howard Webb says Nathan Ake goal for Man City should not have stood
description: Referees' chief Howard Webb says Manchester City's second goal against Fulham was offside, on the first episode of Match Officials: Mic'd Up.

title: Greece: Skiathos and Volos hit by flash floods
description: One person has died in Greece after torrential rain triggered flash flooding in parts of the country.

title: England v New Zealand: Tourists romp home to draw series 2-2
description: England are convincingly beaten by six wickets by New Zealand in the fourth T20 at Trent Bridge as the Black Caps fight back to draw the series 2-2.

title: England v New Zealand: Watch all of Jonny Bairstow's sixes from knock of 73
description: Watch the best shots from England opener Jonny Bairstow's 73 against New Zealand in the fourth and final T20 at Trent Bridge.

title: In Pictures: Stars hit the red carpet at National TV Awards
description: Famous faces of the small screen hit the red carpet in the London sunshine ahead of the ceremony.

title: Jill Biden: US first lady tests positive for Covid-19
description: She is experiencing mild symptoms, the White House says, while President Joe Biden tested negative.

title: US Open 2023 results: Defending champions Joe Salisbury & Rajeev Ram reach men's doubles semis
description: Defending champions Joe Salisbury and Rajeev Ram reach the US Open men's doubles semi-finals with a straight-set win over Maximo Gonzalez and Andres Molteni.

title: United Airlines briefly grounds all US flights after glitch
description: The airline said a "systemwide technology issue" was to blame for a brief disruption.

title: Top Boy: Netflix crime drama bows out with a bang, say TV critics
description: The hit crime drama returns for a final series, with one reviewer saying it "will be sorely missed".

title: Whipsnade Zoo 'over the moon' at birth of endangered monkey
description: The Francois' langur's arrival is said to be "internationally important" for conservation.

title: Emmanuelle Béart: French actress says she was victim of incest
description: The star of Mission: Impossible and Manon des Sources reveals the alleged abuse in a new documentary.

title: Girlhood: The viral agony aunt site for teens blowing up on TikTok
description: Sophia Rundle and Mia Sugimoto tell BBC Newsbeat how they want to create a "safe space" for girls.

title: MPs call for investigation after BBC News report on sewage
description: Opposition MPs and campaigners share "horror" at potential sewage spills on dry days uncovered by BBC News.

title: Tour of Britain: Olav Kooij wins third consecutive stage and retains overall lead
description: Olav Kooij continues his brilliant start to the Tour of Britain by sprinting to a third straight win on stage three in Beverley.

title: Arm Holdings: Chip giant hopes for market value of more than $50bn
description: The UK-based firm is courting investors as its listing in the US looks to be the biggest of the year.

title: David Harewood: Actor says the government should apologise for slavery
description: David Harewood visits a stately home built using the profits of plantations where his ancestors were enslaved.

title: Wilko: One in 12 jobs to go at collapsed retailer
description: Administrators say more than 1,300 staff will be made redundant as hopes of a wider rescue deal fade.

title: Passengers injured on Cleddau Bridge in bus crash
description: Fire crews have declared a major incident and said "many passengers" have suffered injuries.

title: Rare Harry Potter book survives fire and sells for £15,000
description: It is one of only 15 copies of the special edition which were given to competition winners in 2012.

title: Bibby Stockholm: Migrants could be back in weeks, says minister
description: The 39 men had to be removed from the Bibby Stockholm barge when Legionella bacteria was found.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Tom Curry set to start for England against Argentina
description: Flanker Tom Curry is set to play for England in their World Cup opener against Argentina after returning from an ankle injury.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Wales coach Warren Gatland says all players fit to face Fiji
description: Wales coach Warren Gatland says all his players are fit for selection to face Fiji in their World Cup opener on Sunday in Bordeaux.

title: Jorge Vilda: Spanish federation sacks World Cup-winning coach amid Luis Rubiales kiss row
description: Jorge Vilda, Spain's Women's World Cup-winning head coach, has been sacked amid the ongoing Luis Rubiales kiss row.

title: Police probe racist attack on three Ukrainian teens in Edinburgh
description: Officers are treating the assault by several youths in Edinburgh as racially aggravated.

title: M62 crash: Father admits manslaughter after son hit by car
description: Matthew Rycroft's son, Callum, was hit by a car as they tried to cross the carriageway after a crash.

title: Scotland to consider ban on disposable vapes
description: Concerns have been raised about the environmental impact of the plastic tubes, which are often thrown on the ground after use.

title: Champneys founder Dorothy Purdew dies aged 91
description: Born to a working class family, Ms Purdew launched one of the UK's most successful spa chains.

title: Nitrous oxide: Laughing gas to be illegal by end of year
description: Nitrous oxide will become a class C drug in the UK and carry up to two years in jail for possession.

title: Broughton: Homeowners warned of unexpected 'Christmas gnomes'
description: Police warn festive decorations are being left in gardens to target houses for potential burglary.

title: Oxford Street: BBC reporter witnesses attempted robbery live on air
description: Radio London's Anna O'Neill was speaking on air as two men targeted a businessman on Oxford Street.

title: British Challenger 2 tank 'hit' in Ukraine
description: A video shared on social media appears to show a damaged British-made Challenger 2 tank.

title: Adam Peaty: GB swimmer sustains facial injury in training incident with Luke Greenbank
description: Three-time Olympic champion Adam Peaty sustains a facial injury in a minor altercation with fellow Great Britain swimmer Luke Greenbank.

title: Alex Forsyth: Pressure on government to look at Birmingham funding
description: Birmingham City Council's budget crisis puts pressure on the government over council finances.

title: French state schools turn away dozens of girls wearing Muslim abaya dress
description: Dozens of girls are sent home after turning up at school wearing the now-banned abaya robe.

title: Schools struggle over RAAC crumbling concrete measures
description: A governor tells the BBC her school is struggling to find engineers to provide remedial work.

title: Sara Sharif: Father claimed death was accident, says grandad in Pakistan
description: The grandfather of Sara Sharif tells the BBC he spoke to his son when he arrived in Pakistan.

title: Mid Bedfordshire by-election date set for Nadine Dorries' seat
description: A poll is called for October as the former culture secretary steps down weeks after saying she would.

title: UK weather: How hot will it get where you are?
description: After weeks of mixed weather, it's getting a lot warmer in the UK this week.

title: Martha's rule should be introduced, says NHS complaints boss
description: Rob Behrens says he was moved by the plea of Merope Mills, who shared the story of her daughter's death.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs returns lucrative music rights to Bad Boy Records artists
description: Ma$e, Faith Evans and the estate of the Notorious B.I.G. all regain control of their music.

title: All 10 F1 teams complied with 2022 cost cap, says governing body the FIA
description: Governing body the FIA confirms all 10 Formula 1 teams complied with the sport's cost cap in 2022.

title: Which schools in Scotland have RAAC and why haven't they closed?
description: Questions have been raised about the safety of some school buildings after 35 were found to contain RAAC.

title: Woody Allen greeted by cheers, praise and protests at Venice Film Festival
description: The divisive director is met by cheers and positive reviews, but also loud protests on the red carpet.

title: Jadon Sancho: Man Utd boss Erik ten Hag 'not worried about upsetting stars' - Monday Night Club
description: ESPN senior writer Mark Ogden explains the reasoning behind Jadon Sancho's dispute with Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag.

title: Birmingham City Council declares itself effectively bankrupt
description: The largest local authority in Europe issues a distress notice that means all new spending must cease.

title: Spain floods: Boy survives by clinging to tree overnight
description: The 10-year-old climbed on to a tree after his family's car was swept into a river by deadly floods.

title: Cuba uncovers Russia-Ukraine war trafficking ring
description: Cuban officials say a human trafficking ring is recruiting Cubans to fight in the war in Ukraine.

title: US Open 2023: Fan ejected after 'disparaging remark' towards Alexander Zverev
description: A fan is thrown out of the US Open after being accused by Alexander Zverev of using "the most famous Hitler phrase there is in this world".

title: Harry Potter: Proof copy found in Oxford school fails to sell
description: The Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone proof bought for £1 in 1997 was put up for auction.

title: Love Island All Stars: ITV confirms series for 2024
description: After months of rumours, ITV says familiar faces from the show will head back to find love again.

title: Stonehenge tunnel campaigners take petition to UNESCO
description: Leading campaigners are travelling to UNESCO's headquarters in Paris to present a petition.

title: Wilko rival B&M saves up to 51 stores from closure
description: B&M has struck a deal to take on up to 51 of Wilko's 400 shops after it collapsed into administration.

title: Jordan Henderson 'really hurt' by criticism of Saudi Arabia transfer
description: England midfielder Jordan Henderson says criticism of his move to Saudi Arabian club Al-Ettifaq "really hurt".

title: Second dolphin dies in inland Cambridgeshire river
description: A mother dolphin has been found dead in a river in Cambridgeshire two days after its calf died.

title: How worrying is a Russia-Kim Jong Un alliance?
description: An arms deal between North Korea and Russia could suit both sides, and allow them to work more closely.

title: Health and beauty spending boosts August shop sales
description: Retail sales increased by 4.1% last month, according to the British Retail Consortium and KPMG.

title: Rishi Sunak to make it easier for onshore wind farms to be approved
description: It will mean onshore wind farms only need local support, rather than unanimous agreement, to go ahead.

title: Burning Man: Drone footage shows huge queues as people leave festival
description: Drone footage shows people leaving the festival after heavy rain caused a mud bath.

title: China's Great Wall damaged as workers look for shortcut
description: Part of the wall running through China's Shanxi province was dug open, causing severe damage.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Five youngsters to look out for in France
description: BBC Sport profiles five youngsters from outside the home nations who are looking to make their mark at their first World Cup.

title: New Zealand: Plate-sized surgical tool left in woman's abdomen for 18 months
description: The plastic instrument was left in the woman during her C-section delivery at an Auckland hospital.

title: Born To Brawl: Claressa Shields opens up on harrowing journey to top
description: In the latest episode of Born To Brawl, undisputed middleweight boxing world champion Claressa Shields opens up about her harrowing journey to the top of her sport.

title: Matt Smith: Doctor Who star to return to West End stage
description: He will star in a new production of An Enemy of the People, a play first performed in 1882.

title: Ukraine's Olena Zelenska tells of war's impact on family life
description: In a highly personal interview, the first lady says she needs "my husband, not a historical figure, by my side".

title: Theresa May: Portrait of former prime minister unveiled
description: The picture of the UK's second female prime minister is painted by artist Saied Dai.

title: Ukraine war: Sergei Surovikin 'seen in first photo' since Wagner mutiny
description: Sergei Surovikin, a former commander in Ukraine, had not been seen in public since the Wagner mutiny.

title: Hundreds of UK women can now take legal action over Essure device
description: They say the sterilisation device left them in pain - but the manufacturer defends its safety.

title: Family courts: 'We kidnapped our kids from abusive dads and fled the UK’
description: Mothers are breaking the law because they fear court-ordered contact with fathers is unsafe for their kids.

title: Wegovy: Weight-loss drug firm becomes Europe's most valuable
description: Shares rose after the Danish pharmaceutical giant Novo Nordisk launched Wegovy in the UK.

title: Alan Joyce: Qantas boss exits early amid mounting scandals
description: The airline has been criticised for its prices and customer service, and is facing several lawsuits.

title: Water firms illegally spilled sewage on dry days, data suggests
description: Three major companies released sewage on dry days in breach of their permits - BBC investigation.

title: Why has concrete suddenly become headline news?
description: Deep within certain and very particular corners of government, RAAC has been a talking point for years.

title: Peregrine Falcon image wins bird photo award
description: A selection of the winning images from the 2023 Bird Photographer of the Year award.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Minister's TV blunder' and 'Blairites are back'
description: Gillian Keegan's "four-letter rant" is featured on the front of most of Tuesday's papers.
